medical_history.chief_complaint: Sepsis secondary to a central line infection.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with nausea and fatigue about 7 days prior to admission, followed by severe symptoms including vomiting, chills, abdominal pain, hip pain, and myalgias that intensified, leading to an ambulance call for hospital transport. Pain was rated 15 on a scale of 1-10, and symptoms included rigors and deep chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Short gut syndrome, dependence on total parenteral nutrition (TPN), Gardner syndrome diagnosed at age 23, multiple infectious and thrombotic complications of indwelling catheters.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of Gardner syndrome (father and 6 siblings).
medical_history.social_history: Currently living with her mother and has personal care assistants. She previously worked as a nanny. Does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use drugs; enjoys gardening.
